players.title: Donald Bradman
players.description: A legendary Australian cricketer, widely regarded as the greatest batsman of all time.
players.overview: Donald Bradman revolutionized cricket with his batting skills, setting numerous records that remain unbroken.
achievements: Highest batting average in Test cricket
players.legacy: Regarded as the greatest cricketer of all time, with a profound influence on the game.

players.title: Sachin Tendulkar
players.description: Indian cricketer, considered one of the greatest batsmen in the history of cricket.
players.overview: Sachin Tendulkar's career spanned over two decades, during which he became the highest run-scorer in ODI and Test cricket.
achievements: First player to score a double century in an ODI
Most runs in both ODIs and Tests
players.legacy: Tendulkar is revered as a cricketing legend, a symbol of excellence in cricket and sportsmanship.

players.title: Viv Richards
players.description: West Indian cricketer, known for his attacking style and powerful batting.
players.overview: Viv Richards' aggressive batting redefined cricket, setting the standard for modern-day power hitters.
achievements: One of the highest strike rates in ODI cricket
Captain of the West Indies team during a successful era
players.legacy: Richards was a pioneer of attacking cricket, influencing generations of cricketers with his fearless approach.

players.title: Brian Lara
players.description: West Indian cricketer, known for holding the record for the highest individual score in a Test match.
players.overview: Brian Lara's elegant batting style and record-breaking scores made him one of the finest batsmen of his era.
achievements: Highest individual score in a Test match (400*)
One of the few to score over 10,000 runs in both Tests and ODIs
players.legacy: Lara is considered one of the greatest batsmen in the history of cricket, particularly known for his ability to play under pressure.

players.title: Shane Warne
players.description: Australian cricketer, widely regarded as one of the greatest bowlers in the history of the game.
players.overview: Shane Warne revolutionized leg-spin bowling, taking over 700 wickets in Test cricket and leaving an indelible mark on the game.
achievements: Most wickets taken in Test matches by an Australian
Revolutionized the art of leg-spin bowling
players.legacy: Warne's impact on cricket extends beyond statistics; he changed the way leg-spin bowling was viewed and played.
